us_world.title: A Mother of Five Survived the Flood to Return to a Cabin in Ruins
us_world.summary: Jaque White and her five children escaped the rising waters of the Guadalupe River just in time. Now they have to rebuild.

us_world.title: ICE Raids Scare Off L.A. Workers Rebuilding Fire-Torn Areas
us_world.summary: Immigrant workers are central to recovery efforts in neighborhoods burned in the January wildfires, but recent raids have led some to stay home.

us_world.title: Farmworker Dies After Fleeing a Federal Raid in Southern California
us_world.summary: During a chaotic raid in Ventura County on Thursday, the worker fell from a greenhouse at a cannabis farm, suffered spinal and skull injuries, and died on Friday.

us_world.title: Judge Orders Los Angeles Police to Stop Shooting Projectiles at Journalists
us_world.summary: Los Angeles Police Department officers fired foam projectiles and flash-bang devices at reporters and photographers who were covering the immigration protests in June.

us_world.title: Man Had 14 Toucans Stashed in His Volkswagen Dashboard, U.S. Says
us_world.summary: Carlos Abundez, 35, is facing federal smuggling charges after U.S. Customs and Border Protection officers made the discovery. The birds, a threatened species, were in stable condition.

us_world.title: Texas Floods Often Threatened Camp Mystic
us_world.summary: Within six years of opening, Camp Mystic was inundated with floodwaters. It was the first of many times.

us_world.title: Man Falls to His Death Descending Mountain in Glacier National Park
us_world.summary: The man fell from a steep, off-trail climbing route on the west side of Mount Gould, the authorities said.

us_world.title: Man Who Decapitated Father and Displayed Head on YouTube Gets Life in Prison
us_world.summary: Justin Mohn, 33, of Levittown, Pa., was convicted on murder and terrorism charges in the 2024 killing of his father, Michael.

us_world.title: ‘They Kept Coming’: Hundreds of Packages Pile Up Outside Woman’s Home
us_world.summary: A year ago, misdirected Amazon returns began arriving at Karen Holton’s house in California. Eventually, she said, they were stacked so high that she could not easily use her door.

us_world.title: Schumer Urges RFK Jr. to Declare Public Health Emergency Over Measles
us_world.summary: Senator Chuck Schumer urged the health secretary to declare an emergency to keep other regions from experiencing the “nightmare” seen in Texas.

cultural.title: You're Not Ready for This 'Premium Economy' Seat
cultural.summary: Through the feedback loop of consumerist culture, Anna Uddenberg investigates how body culture, spirituality, and self-staging are intertwined with the mediation and production of subjectivity by new technologies and circulation of forms. Her practice integrates approaches to gender while acting as a space for reflecting on taste and class, appropriation and sexuality, pushing these questions into new material territories.

cultural.title: The New (Ocean) Dark Age
cultural.summary: Facing rising temperatures, a spike in acidity driven by an influx of carbon, mass habitat destruction, and inescapable pollution, the world's oceans haven't had it easy. But in an ominously literal sense, the situation may be even darker than we realized. [Futurism]

cultural.title: Interpreting live music through Auslan is about more than just lyrics
cultural.summary:
Why interpreting live music through Auslan is about more than just lyrics. While familiar at emergency announcements and press conferences, Auslan interpreters are now becoming increasingly common at concerts .
(Auslan is the sign language used by the majority of the Australian Deaf community. Auslan is related to British Sign Language and New Zealand Sign Language; the three have descended from the same parent language, and together comprise the BANZSL language family.)

cultural.title: I fought the LLM and the LLM won
cultural.summary:
On Thursday, a digital rights group, the Electronic Frontier Foundation, published an expansive investigation into AI-generated police reports that the group alleged are, by design, nearly impossible to audit and could make it easier for cops to lie under oath. Axon's Draft One debuted last summer at a police department in Colorado, instantly raising questions about the feared negative impacts of AI-written police reports on the criminal justice system. The tool relies on a ChatGPT variant to generate police reports based on body camera audio, which cops are then supposed to edit to correct any mistakes, assess the AI outputs for biases, or add key context.

But the EFF found that the tech "seems designed to stymie any attempts at auditing, transparency, and accountability." Cops don't have to disclose when AI is used in every department, and Draft One does not save drafts or retain a record showing which parts of reports are AI-generated. Departments also don't retain different versions of drafts, making it difficult to assess how one version of an AI report might compare to another to help the public determine if the technology is "junk," the EFF said. That raises the question, the EFF suggested, "Why wouldn't an agency want to maintain a record that can establish the technology's accuracy?"

cultural.title: The LGBTQIA+ News Post, July 11, 2025: Nothin' Keeps You Revvin'
cultural.summary:
Welcome to the LGBTQIA+ News Post for July 11. It's been a while, but I know you wanted me to stay . I just want to let people know that part of the delay was a need to wait for some money to get Pepto-Bismol so I could deal with the nausea .

Some Housekeeping before getting started: it was made known to me that screen readers do not deal with strikethroughs well at all. I was unaware of this, and apologize to anyone that had an issue as the result. I won't be using them anymore, instead putting my sarcasm and anger out in the open like my predecessors in this sort of thing like Jon Stewart and Keith Olbermann. The Bad News Let's get started with the absolute pettiest crap ever. Bethel Church in Crown Point, IN, removed a teen, Bryce Fech, from a position of leadership last year when he came out as gay. His family then left the church. This year, the church called the Christian summer camp Bryce was about to attend to out him - despite his family not being involved in that church anymore - causing the summer camp to inform him that he was not welcome. I mean, seriously, folks, go and show us how there's no hate like "Christian" love...

The Federal Trade Commission hosted what can only be called an anti-trans workshop : FTC Chair Andrew Ferguson framed the event as an investigation into potential "fraud and deception" in medical treatment, just weeks after the U.S. Supreme Court's landmark U.S. v. Skrmetti ruling upheld Tennessee's ban on gender-affirming care for minors. Ferguson also accused the Biden administration of trying to influence the World Professional Association for Transgender Health to make it easier for minors to get hormones and surgeries, and "declared it the FTC's duty to investigate claims around gender-affirming care." One of the speakers also accused Dr. Rachel Levine, who served as assistant secretary for health during the Biden administration, of bringing that political pressure. pausing for a gulp of Pepto. Claiming to be part of the same "fraud and deception" investigation, the Department of In Justice has issued subpoenas to doctors and clinics that provide gender-affirming care to minors . I'm sure that this is gonna go well and have no repercussions down the line.

And the Department of Ill Health and InHuman Services is now investigating the University of Michigan Health system, based on allegations that the hospital fired a nurse's aide "for exercising her Federally protected rights of conscience" by acting, and again I quote, "against her sincerely held religious convictions and her medical conscience, that she would speak biology-obscuring pronouns and make referrals for 'gender transition' drugs and procedures." No Hate Like "Christian" Love, Part II.

The Regime has filed suit against California after the state stated they would not comply with the administration's demands to end their trans-inclusive policy on student sports and enforce bathroom restrictions. The suit includes quotes from Governor Gavin "All Bets Must Be Hedged" Newsom's podcast, where he questioned the fairness of letting trans girls compete against cis girls.

The Department of the Interior has gotten out the scissors again and removed references to bisexuals from Stonewall . How soon until it's just called a riot?

Department of Transportation secretary Sean Duffy has sent a letter to all 50 governors, the governor of Puerto Rico, and the mayor of Washington DC, asking them to remove rainbow sidewalks, claiming without evidence that they distract drivers making them crash their cars or hit pedestrians. This is a man who harassed a lesbian for sex on TV, so his opinions are already suspect.

The Supreme Court will hear two challenges to state laws that ban transgender students from participating in girls' and women's sports in its next term . I think we can predict the outcome of this one already.

Baylor University is returning a $643,000 grant to study women and LGBTQ+ people in the church just two weeks after receiving it. As a right-wing evangelical Christian university, they claim it "extended into advocacy for perspectives on human sexuality that are inconsistent with Baylor's institutional policies." I mean, they let Ken Starr be president, only firing him when it was made totally obvious how deliberately he had not investigated sexual assaults, but hey, that's just him making sure "promising young men" don't have their careers damaged, right?

And the University of Pennsylvania has sold its soul and proven itself to be run by cowards by banning trans athletes and stripping Lia Thomas of all her titles . They claim it was after their Athletic Department's Office of Civil Rights determined doing so was a violation of Title IX regulations. This won't save them.

In Florida, trans woman Marcy Rheintgen was arrested for using a lavatory for women inside a state building in March, violating the state bathroom ban . She faced 11 months in jail for the violation. As the next part of the story goes: Prosecutors reportedly failed to meet the deadline for filing charging documents against Marcy Rheintgen after she was arrested while protesting the state's anti-trans bathroom ban. A Leon County judge granted her lawyer's motion to dismiss the misdemeanor trespassing charge. Who ran this case, Alina Habba?

Runner Caster Semenya of South Africa has won a case in the European Court of Human Rights , that the Swiss Court of Arbitration violated her rights by holding up the World Athletics decision to disqualify her from events due to her naturally higher testosterone levels. She has been fighting this for seven years, and no longer competes, but is continuing the fight so that it does not affect athletes in the future.

And finally, science wants people to know: "People whose gender identity differs from their birth sex drink more alcohol and engage in more hazardous drinking than cisgender heterosexual peers, according to findings published July 6 in the journal Alcohol: Clinical & Experimental Research ." (The second link is to the paper in question.) The Good News North Carolina Governor Josh Stein, a Democrat, vetoed three bills that targeted DEI programs and had anti-transgender provisions. Thanks, Josh!

Tennis legent Billie Jean King has stated in an interview , "I don't think people have any idea of how hard it is for trans people," King said. "Just listen to their stories. Listen — not tell them. Everyone is unique. Make them feel included because you really don't know. With every person I meet, I try to start with a blank. Ask questions." Thank you, Billie!

The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission has stated they will start processing cases of gender identity discrimination again , claiming they will process cases that "fall squarely" under the 2020 Bostock v Clayton County decision. Hopefully they really will!

The Band of The Household Cavalry celebrated Pride in London in a great way: by covering Chappell Roan's "Pink Pony Club" in front of Buckingham Palace (YouTube Link to the performance). 

Renee Rapp would like to offer you some advice on what to do if you have a homophobic parent .

And a big thank you to rrrrrrrrrt for this bit of happy news: Same-sex penguin couple raising rare chick at U.K. zoo . All cheer Scampi and Flounder! The Cinnamon Roll Report "Lesbian Jesus" Hayley Kiyoko has reportedly gotten engaged to her longtime partner Becca Tilley. The former Wizards of Waverly Place star and performer of lesbian anthem "Girls Like Girls" posted pictures on Instagram (as you do) and they look very happy.

And since this IS the CRR, you know who I have to mention: On the red carpet in Berlin for the premiere of Fantastic Four: First Steps, he said : "It's important to protect people, especially those simply asking for the right to exist in bodies that belong to them and in the world that they never asked to be brought into.

"It's a very, very small, vulnerable, inspiring, courageous and brave community that fills me with a lot of inspiration. Therefore, it's very important to protect that. They would do that for us." Be well, friends. If you have news I missed or personal triumphs, bring them here! Let us know your joys. I thank my wicked dreams, a year from Tennessee
Oh, Santa Monica, you've been too good to me
Won't make my mama proud, it's gonna cause a scene
She sees her baby girl, I know she's gonna scream...

local.title: Jake Bird Earns Win for Colorado Rockies in 3-2 Game Against Cincinnati Reds on July 11, 2025
local.summary: Jake Bird of the Colorado Rockies pitched one inning with one strikeout in a 3-2 win against the Cincinnati Reds on July 11, 2025. Jake Bird pitched one inning and struck out one batter in the Rockies' 3-2 win against the Reds.

local.title: Victor Vodnik Records Save for Colorado Rockies in 3-2 Win Over Cincinnati Reds on July 11, 2025
local.summary: Victor Vodnik secured a save for the Colorado Rockies in their 3-2 win over the Cincinnati Reds, striking out three batters in one inning on July 11, 2025. Victor Vodnik played a key role in the Colorado Rockies' 3-2 win over the Cincinnati Reds.

local.title: Ryan McMahon Hits Home Run and Drives in 2 Runs in Rockies' 3-2 Win Over Reds on July 11, 2025
local.summary: Ryan McMahon helped the Colorado Rockies win 3-2 over the Cincinnati Reds with 3 hits, including a home run, and 2 RBIs on July 11, 2025. Ryan McMahon had a strong game on July 11, 2025, against the Cincinnati Reds.

local.title: Germán Márquez Strikes Out 8 in Colorado Rockies' 3-2 Win Over Cincinnati Reds on July 11, 2025
local.summary: Germán Márquez of the Colorado Rockies struck out 8 batters in their 3-2 win over the Cincinnati Reds on July 11, 2025. Germán Márquez had a strong game against the Cincinnati Reds, striking out 8 batters over 6 innings.
